thread.title: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt thanks their fans for braving the cold weather in their win over the Miami Dolphins: 'Playoff victory Monday hits different!'
thread.title_full: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt thanks their fans for braving the cold weather in their win over the Miami Dolphins: 'Playoff victory Monday hits different!'

author: VNExplorer
title: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt thanks their fans for braving the cold weather in their win over the Miami Dolphins: 'Playoff victory Monday hits different!'
text:
The Chiefs defeated the Dolphins 26-7, advancing into the divisional playoffsThe weather conditions led to Chiefs coach Andy Reid's mustache freezing overDailyMail.com provides all the latest international sports news
Gracie Hunt, daughter of Kansas City Chiefs owner Clark Hunt, thanked the persistent fans who supported their team on Saturday despite the frigid conditions in Kansas City.
The wildcard win over Miami Dolphins somehow took place in minus four degrees at Arrowhead Stadium. It felt even colder with a wind chill of minus 27/
On an Instagram post, Hunt shared a series of photos with her family during the game, while voicing her amazement towards the fans.
‘Playoff victory Monday hits different,’ she wrote. ‘I’m always amazed by the Chiefs fan base.’
‘Chiefs Kingdom is so special. Thank you for showing up and braving the cold this weekend. You’re the real MVPs!’
Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt thanked fans for braving the cold weather on Saturday
Hunt posted pictures of her family on Instagram while singing her praises for their supporters
The conditions led to Kansas City coach Andy Reid’s mustache freezing into tiny icicles
The Chiefs went on to defeat the Miami Dolphins, 7-26, under the freezing weather conditions
The cold did not keep 76,416 fans from coming together to support their Chiefs as they soundly defeated Miami and a returning Tyreek Hill.
The weather conditions even resulted in Chiefs coach Andy Reid’s mustache freezing into icicles.
Meanwhile, popstar and Travis Kelce cheerleader Taylor Swift gave her scarf to a fan in a nearby section so they could keep warm
The Chiefs managed to secure a lopsided win, despite Patrick Mahomes missing nearly half of his attempts. He completed 23 of 41 attempts for 262 yards and a touchdown.
Running back Isiah Pacheco led them in rushing yards with 89 while wide receiver Rashee Rice led in receiving with 130 yards. Both men contributed a touchdown to their victory.
The Chiefs await the winner between the Buffalo Bills and Pittsburgh Stealers on Monday night.
